intro: Linum tenuifolium var. salsoloides, commonly known as narrow-leaved flax variant salsoloides, is a flowering plant belonging to the Linaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a low-growing habit with a sprawling or prostrate stem. This variety is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and provide habitat for native insects.
